required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise in Testicular Germ Cell Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Exercise in Prevention & Treatment of Chemotherapy-related Late Toxicity in Testicular Germ Cell Cancer Survivors: the Role of Skeletal Muscle

brief_summary.textblock:
Regular exercise is effective in prevention & treatment of chronic diseases. Exercise can reduce late toxicity of chemotherapy, commonly found in cancer survivors, which is yet to be translated into clinical practice.
Mechanisms of exercise benefits in oncologic patients are far from being elucidated, and include increase in muscle mass, reduction of fat mass, systemic inflammation and cardiometabolic risk. Synchronization of exercise adaptive response is, to an extent, mediated by bioactive molecules released from muscle, with anti-inflammatory & tumor-suppressing properties. Muscle satellite cells are a source of regeneration, muscle structural integrity & functional capacity. Phenotypes of muscle cells, such as secretory profile, lipid & glucose metabolism, mirror clinical phenotypes of the donor. Importantly, muscle cells' metabolism in vitro can be modulated by 8-12 week training in vivo. Epigenetic mechanisms regulating muscle & systemic metabolism in cancer survivors are not yet understood.

study_design_info.masking_description: lab technicians and statistician are blinded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: parameter will be measured before and after 6 month intervention
primary_outcome.description: change in glucose tolerance (as measured by oral glucose tolerance test)

primary_outcome.measure: change in resting energy expenditiure and metabolic substrate preference
primary_outcome.time_frame: parameters will be measured twice before and after 6 month intervention
primary_outcome.description: change in resting energy expenditure calculated by Weir equation from VO2 and metabolic substrate preference RQ VCO2/VO2 (as measured by indirect calorimetry)

primary_outcome.time_frame: parameters will be measured twice before and after 6 month intervention
primary_outcome.description: BMI (kg.m-2) , fat mass (% electric bioimpedance), lean body mass (% electric bioimpedance), visceral adiposity (%, elecgtric bioimpedance)

primary_outcome.time_frame: parameter will be measured twice before and after 6 month intervention
primary_outcome.description: VO2max (mlO2 per kg BW min) as measured by bicycle spiroergometry

secondary_outcome.measure: change in quality of life for cancer patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured twice before and after 6 month intervention
measured twice before and after 6 month intervention
measured twice before and after 6 month intervention

arm_group.description: TGCT survivors, men, 25-55 yrs old, 3 and more years after successful treatment of TGCT, with the capacity to undergo aerobic-strength intervention assessed by cardiologist
TGCT survivors, men, 25-55 yrs old, 3 and more years after successful treatment of TGCT, with the capacity to undergo aerobic-strength intervention assessed by cardiologist

intervention.description: 6 month supervised exercise intervention in TGCT survivors (1 hour sessions 3 x per week),

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- TGCT survivors, with chemotherapy-induced metabolic toxicity, men, 25-55 years old, with the capacity to undergo training, signed written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious / uncontrolled chronic diseases, non-compliance, other health issues as assessed by oncologists / investigators

overall_official.affiliation: Biomedical Research Center, Slovak Acad Sci

facility.name: Biomedical Research Center Slovak Academy of Sciences

patient_data.ipd_description: we will share IPD upon reasonable request
